reviews.review_msg: Tests are too monotonous. Always uses same format. If you're not great at essay paragraphs avoid this class. Interesting lectures but he's a slow talker.

There's a reason professors should have their phD BEFORE teaching at the 300-level... he marked NOTHING, and let the TA's (who were unavailable for any questions) mark everything. If you can, wait and take this class with Bob Ley.

Although he is only a sessional prof, Travis is very experienced and professional in his field. Lectures were a bit boring and he tends to ramble on and on, but it was still interesting. He gives out study questions for his tests which really helps. Make sure you follow what he wants on the essays. Over all great prof!

This class has a lot of potential. Robert Ley has interesting stories but his lecture is unbalanced. He gives little insight to the content of his exams besides "study the book". This is difficult when studying 12 chapters for a cumulative final exam. The course is frustrating unless you have days and days to read the whole text. Be wary.
This guy is the man, don't need to attend his lectures but they're pretty entertaining. No powerpoint slides, don't need to take notes just read the textbook and you'll be fine
